issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
There are two Q&A topics from users that claim to have correctly installed the Windows SDK and are even able to run an app through Visual Studio but see Titanium fail and {{ti info}} saying:

{quote}
Microsoft Windows Store SDK is missing the deploy command.
{quote}

This originates from:
https://github.com/appcelerator/windowslib/blob/master/lib/winstore.js#L347-L355
 
* https://community.appcelerator.com/topic/2924/can-t-add-windows-local-machine-in-run-configuration-for-writing-the-apps-for-windows-8-1-store-desktop
* https://community.appcelerator.com/topic/3090/titanium-studio-windows-phone-sdk-problem
fields.summary: Cannot build with Windows SDK: "Microsoft Windows Store SDK is missing the deploy command."

comments.body: Public update: We don't support building to Windows Store from Studio, nor Windows 10 or Visual Studio 2015 atm.
So the workaround is using a Windows 8.1 machine?
Until we announce Windows 10 support.. yes
Closing, I think this is obsolete for now. Please create new ticket if this is still the case.
